entries.title: RCS temperature rises during isolated PZR heating with no RCP active
RHR isolation initiates on first RCP start instead of post-4-RCP near-350F sequence
SG startup draining contract at ~200F is not wired into runtime execution path
HZP subsystem initialization occurs in UPDATE path (lazy init phase leakage)
BubbleFormation initializes CVCS controller during UPDATE phase transition
PlantConstants partials execute runtime calculation logic (GOLD constants-file fail gate)
Primary boundary mass transfer uses fixed 100F atmospheric density instead of runtime state
Stage E primary-heat telemetry is aliased to SG removal, collapsing over-primary validation signal
Simulation-facing files exceed GOLD hard size limits without documented waiver
Heatup engine state is exposed as ad-hoc mutable public fields without typed snapshot boundary
PERF THREAD_BLOCKING_RISK: synchronous interval file writes execute on main simulation thread
PERF ALLOCATION_HOT_PATH: SG multi-node update allocates transient mixing array each step
PERF GC_PRESSURE_RISK: Stage E dynamic window analysis allocates via Queue.ToArray in recurring path
PERF LOGGING_SPAM: high-frequency Debug.Log calls embedded in simulation substep paths
CondensingHTC uses unsourced coefficient and hard clamps in physics correlation
HeatupSimEngine header lacks mandatory GOLD C01 sections (SOURCES and UNITS)
Coordinator owns multiple writer paths for T_rcs/pressure with post-module mutation
Validation failure: Bubble draw duration exceeds documented expectation (~165-180 min observed vs 30-60 min expected)
DRAIN progression is strongly constrained by fixed post-CCP net outflow policy (75 letdown, 44 charging, net 31 gpm)
Steam displacement declared primary, but DRAIN volumetric reconciliation path de-emphasizes steam mass-to-volume closure
40-minute DRAIN constant is advisory only; state machine transition is level-threshold driven
Procedure alignment risk: startup reference max-letdown/min-charging intent differs from fixed DRAIN policy (75/0->44)
HeatupValidationVisual redesign from tabbed layout to unified instrumentation screen
SG secondary pressure response does not begin at RCP circulation onset; rise is delayed until near-boiling
RCP startup permissive is configured below documented minimum startup pressure requirements.
RCP heat-input constants do not align with the cited cold-water heatup reference basis.
